newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: ROKISHKIS PLANS NEW SHARE ISSUE.
newsitem.headline: ROKISHKIS PLANS NEW SHARE ISSUE.

text.p: Lithuania's Rokishkis Cheese said on Tuesday that it was considering an issue of 200,000 new shares with a face value of 10 litas to obtain funds to upgrade its production facility.

"We are planning to suggest to the general shareholders' meeting to vote for a new issue of around 200,000 new shares with a face value of ten litas," director of the company, Antanas Trumpa, told Reuters.
"The decision of a board meeting scheduled for Friday is also necessary," Trumpa added. The general shareholders' meeting is scheduled for June 6.
"We expect to collect eight million litas after the share issue is distributed," Trumpa said.
Trumpa said that half of the sum will go to milk producers to improve milk collecting facilities and the other half to introduce new technologies in the company itself.
Part of the sum will go to train the staff, he added.
Rokishkis Cheese is one of the blue chips of Vilnius bourse listed on the oficial list among three top companies and two banks.
